title: Amazon changes tune, makes Weinstein book available in Australia
text:
Amazon has backflipped on its decision not to make the tale of Ronan Farrow’s investigation into Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein available to customers in Australia following legal threats from a former Australian journalist.

After initially yielding to legal threats last week from lawyers acting for Dylan Howard, a former Seven Network sports reporter who became an executive at American Media Inc (AMI), Amazon has now quietly made Mr Farrow’s newly published book, Catch and Kill: Lies, Spies and a Conspiracy to Protect Predators, available on its Australian store.

Ronan Farrow urges Australian booksellers not to be intimidated by threats of legal retaliation for selling his book about Harvey Weinstein. Gilbert Carrasquillo

Mr Farrow won a Pulitzer Prize for public service for his investigation into Mr Weinstein, published in the The New Yorker in 2017.

Last week, the book was available on the online retail giant’s US store, but not the Australian one, with observers pointing to this country's much more onerous defamation laws. However, on Sunday, the book was available on Amazon Australia, in Kindle, audiobook, paperback and hardcover versions.

Amazon declined to comment. Booktopia also decided to not sell the book and on Sunday it still remained unavailable. Many smaller bricks and mortar book shops received the legal threats, but pushed ahead with making it available last week anyway. Mr Howard's Australian lawyer, Andrew Thorpe, did not have a comment about Amazon's change when contacted on Sunday.
description: Amazon has now quietly made Ronan Farrow's blockbuster available in its Australian store.
